title: Liverpool in talks over £26million William Carvalho deal? Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's papers
text:
Sport Liverpool in talks over £26million William Carvalho deal? Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's papers PLUS: Inter Milan, Juventus and AC Milan are in a three-way race to sign Chelsea midfielder Cesc Fabregas Share Portugal's midfielder William Carvalho (L) vies with Poland's forward Arkadiusz Milik (Photo: AFP) Share Get football updates   Thank you for subscribing!   
Liverpool are in discussions over a deal for Sporting Lisbon midfielder William Carvalho, according to a report in Portugal. 
Newspaper A Bola claims that a trip to Lisbon to smooth over Lazar Markovic’s move to Hull was used by representatives to sound out the Primeira Liga side over signing the Euro 2016 winner. 
The report says the Reds will have to cough up around £26million for the 24-year-old. 
Here are Wednesday's other top stories... Philippe Coutinho is set to sign a record-breaking deal with Liverpool (Photo: Getty) Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's Mirror 
World-rated Coutinho will agree a five-and-a-half year contract that will make him the Reds' highest-paid current player — and could even match the £200,000-plus a week pact with Luis Suarez that was the richest in Anfield history. 
Crucially, there will be NO buy-out clause in the contract. 
Frenchman Pires is working with the Gunners as a first-team coach and has revealed that he has had a conversation with the Chilean forward about his contract situation. Dimitri Payet continues to train with West Ham's Under 23 squad (Photo: Headlinephoto/Vantagenews.com) 
West Ham could be forced to loan out wantaway midfielder Dimitri Payet . 
Marseille insist they won't improve on their latest offer of £25million plus £3m in add-ons, while the Hammers will not accept anything less than £35m. 
The French club are now hoping a loan deal can be brokered, with a fixed price to be paid to make the move permanent in the summer. 
Sam Allardyce could be set for amazing reunions with Yann M’Vila and Chris Samba at Crystal Palac e. 
M’Vila has got an £11million buy-out clause from Russian club Rubin Kazan, and Big Sam is considering moving for the France midfielder he had on loan at Sunderland last season. 
Former Blackburn defender Samba is also training with Palace after being released from his contract with Greek club Panathinaikos. Yann M'Vila could come to Sam Allardyce's rescue again (Photo: Sunderland AFC via Getty) 
AC Milan boss Vincenzo Montella has revealed that French forward M'Baye Niang could leave the club this month . 
Niang has been the subject of reports linking him with a move to Arsenal and West Ham during the January transfer window and Montella has confirmed he would not play in the Rossoneri's Coppa Italia quarter-final against Juventus. 
Championship promotion chasers Newcastle had been among those interested. Odion Ighalo is reconsidering a move to China (Photo: Tony Marshall / Getty)
